On Thursday, October 10, 2019 Burton Glen Charter Academy participated in their first Apple Crunch! They joined 1.8 million other scholars across Michigan in schools, preschools, and nonprofits to celebrate Farm to School Month and Apple Crunch Day.

Michigan competed in a six-State Crunch Off against Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, and Ohio to determine who will be crowned the Great Lakes Region Crunch Champion through having the most crunches into local apples per capita.

This Crunch event encourages healthy eating, supports local agriculture and helps students and community members gain a deeper understanding of the food system.

Regional Macintosh apples from Applewood Farms in Sparta, Michigan were brought in for the students to crunch today while they were educated on fun facts surrounding all things apples.

A big THANK YOU to Mr. Williams and the Burton Glen community for being willing to participate and a SHOUT OUT to the Preferred Meals staff for help with passing out all the apples.

#GreatAppleCrunch #cultivatemichigan #F2SMonth #MIAppleCru
